TopicTitle: Ok, who botched the asteroid redirect mission.....

Articles.Content: Screw the commenters. First off the rock would've cooled off and before atmo it was much larger. That was a close one though.
A rock of that size would have resulted from a much bigger rock that would have light up a streak across the sky. Do they mention seeing anything else in the sky?

A rock of that size would have resulted from a much bigger rock that would have light up a streak across the sky. Do they mention seeing anything else in the sky?

How often does anyone see meteors in daylight? (unless you're in Russia, on a VERY specific day.)
Yep, saw this, totally lucky miss for that guy, but amazing!
Occam's razor would suggest it got packed in with his parachute.

A rock of that size would have resulted from a much bigger rock that would have light up a streak across the sky. Do they mention seeing anything else in the sky?

In one news article a they had some scientist (I think it was a geologist) confirming there was an explosion on the sky at the same time.

Occam's razor would suggest it got packed in with his parachute.

The only problem with that is that the person packing the chute would have had to be a complete moron in order to not notice a rock that size.

Not only that imagine what could go wrong with a rock in a parachute.
Is it possible another diver off screen just through it at him? I mean... I WANT to believe this, but.. I don't.
